issue.title: refactor(http1): Replace usage of mem::uninitialized with MaybeUninit

body:
One problem with refactoring the code is that [httparse::Request::new](https://docs.rs/httparse/1.4.0/httparse/struct.Request.html#method.new) accepts `&mut [Header]`, so it is assumed that they are initialized. It would need to accept `&mut [MaybeUninit<Header>]`

Otherwise `MaybeUninit::uninit().assume_init()` (like it is done [here](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2536)) gives the same problems as `mem::uninitialized`

issue.title: Need for `Request` to take a slice of `MaybeUninit<Header>`

repository.name: httparse
repository.description: A push parser for the HTTP 1.x protocol in Rust.

issue.body:
Context: `hyper` passes [uninitialized array](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/master/src/proto/h1/role.rs#L131) of `httparse::Header` to `Request::new`.
This is undefined behavior and I discovered it while working on [Replacing `mem::uninitialized` with `MaybeUninit`](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2532)

I acknowledge that changing `headers` field will be a breaking change, because it is public, so
is there a chance that a `Request` type copy could be implemented, but with `headers: &mut [MaybeUninit<Header>]`?

EDIT: I just realized that author of `httparse` is also author of `hyper` :sweat_smile:

issue.title: Use new methods for parsing with uninitialized headers from httparse
issue.body:
This patch fixes #2532
It uses methods implemented ~~[in this PR](https://github.com/seanmonstar/httparse/pull/97)~~ [in this PR](https://github.com/seanmonstar/httparse/pull/98), so CI might fail before it gets merged

body: FYI, this seems to be one of the major sources of regressions in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/87041.
